revised_title: Choline Detection in Nervous System Degenerative Diseases
tldr: The authors investigated the presence of choline in the blood and cerebrospinal fluid of patients with various nervous system degenerative diseases, such as General Paralysis of the Insane, combined sclerosis, and beri-beri. They found that choline could be detected in the blood of these patients using chemical and physiological tests. The authors also studied the ionization of cats' sciatic nerves and the behavior of positively and negatively charged ions in atmospheric electricity.
